item.title: Accumulation of hard round berries from large tree, 16th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Station Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Obstruction - view of traffic for pedestrians, 16th September
item.description:
The brushes have overgrown and are obscuring the view for pedestrians crossing the road. This is a popular crossing place for children due to the park and local schools. Can’t see oncoming traffic in both directions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture dumped plus Clothes bin full so bags dumped and, 16th September
item.description:
The clothes bin is full (yet again…) so bags been dumped and emptied As this happens to regularly (4-5x a week), clearly local people think it’s a rubbish area and some furniture been added to the rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109-115, Blackfriars Road, Southwark, London

item.title: Large Fly Tip, 16th September
item.description:
This fly tip has appeared in the last 48 hours. It is partially blocking access to a 24/7 Railway site used for Engineering works and Emergency Access and Egress during railway incidents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hart Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on the corner of Mell Street and Trafalgar Road., 16th September
item.description:
This is an ongoing and continual problem. Every week we have this foul mess outside where we live. It looks dreadful, it encourages, vermin, it smells and it's a complete eyesore. We keep complaining about it and occasionally it is dealt with only to reappear days afterwards. It must be sorted once and for all. Decent bins outside Tesco and several around the pocket park might help. Can you get in touch with us please and let us know why this is not being dealt with. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 142 - 146, Trafalgar Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More bin bags dumped and split open, 16th September
item.description:
Another large quantity of bin bags have been dumped by the crossing near the tattoo parlour on Nuxley Road. Some have split open or been torn open by animals. This is now the eighth time I have reported this recurring issue in the same location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Nuxley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
